method: First calculate the mass of pure CaCO3 in the limestone sample: 5.00 g × 0.840 = 4.20 g. Then convert to moles using Mr(CaCO3) = 100.1: n(CaCO3) = 4.20 g / 100.1 g mol-1 = 0.04196 mol. From the balanced equation, the molar ratio CaCO3:CO2 is 1:1, so n(CO2) = 0.04196 mol. Finally, mass of CO2 = n × Mr(CO2) = 0.04196 mol × 44.0 g mol-1 = 1.846 g, rounded to 1.85 g.
checks: Mass balance check: 4.20 g CaCO3 produces maximum 1.85 g CO2, which is reasonable since Mr(CO2)/Mr(CaCO3) = 44.0/100.1 ≈ 0.44.
